title: ‘Absolutely Shocking’: Impeachment Experts Say Biden Inquiry May Be Weakest in US History
description: Two impeachment experts tell TIME there is less evidence implicating Biden of wrongdoing than any previous inquiries into a president.

title: What’s Behind the Spike in Child Poverty in the U.S.
description: According to new figures from the U.S. Census Bureau, 12.4% of children were living in poverty in 2022.

title: Spain’s World Cup Win is a Reminder of How Women’s Sports are Still Fighting for Progress
Why Kevin McCarthy Is So Scared He Opened an Impeachment Inquiry
description: This article is part of The D.C. Brief, TIME’s politics newsletter. Sign up here to get stories like this sent to your inbox. Lacking the votes to move forward with an impeachment inquiry into President Joe Biden, House Speaker Kevin McCarthy on Tuesday made the unilateral and unusual decision to plow forward with committee-level probes…

title: The Real Story of the Fake Contract Killer Behind Richard Linklater’s Hit Man
description: In Richard Linklater's new comedy, Glen Powell plays a chameleonic man who poses as a contract killer to catch the people looking to hire a real one.

title: Common Nasal Decongestant Doesn’t Actually Work, According to FDA Advisors
description: A panel of advisers to the U.S. FDA said that phenylephrine, a main component of over-the-counter cold medicines, doesn’t actually work.

title: Why It Takes Forever to Get a Doctor’s Appointment
description: Doctors are working harder and longer, all while patients can access them less.

title: Facing Pressure from Hard Right, McCarthy Directs House to Open Biden Impeachment Inquiry
description: The inquiry will center on whether Biden played a role in, or benefited from, his son Hunter Biden’s overseas business affairs.

title: How to Help Flood Victims in Libya
description: At least 2,300 have died and 10,000 people are believed missing after two dams collapsed on the northeastern coast.

title: Shakira’s 15 Best Music Videos, Ranked
description: Shakira is receiving the MTV VMA Video Vanguard Award. Here's a look back at all of her most iconic videos from her decades spanning career.

title: Too Many Mothers Are Dying in Childbirth. Here’s How They Can Be Saved
description: The Gates Foundation's 2023 Goalkeepers report proposes ways to prevent maternal and newborn deaths, even in wealthy countries.

title: The Real Story of the Outrageous Pharma Scandal that Inspired Pain Hustlers
description: The director and author behind Netflix's crime drama on the how the movie starring Emily Blunt and Chris Evans fictionalized the story of an opioid scandal.

title: TIME Reveals 2023 TIME100 Impact Award Recipients Ahead of Second Annual Celebration at the National Gallery Singapore
description: The Evening Celebration will Feature Appearances by Honorees including Ayushmann Khurrana, Eric Nam, Ke Huy Quan, Elizabeth Wathuti and Zainab Salbi Today, TIME reveals the recipients of the second TIME100 Impact Awards in Singapore, which recognizes visionaries who have gone above and beyond to make an impact and move their respective industries forward. The new…

title: California Lawmakers Approve The Country’s Most Sweeping Corporate Climate Disclosure Rules
description: Major corporations will have to disclose their direct and indirect emissions under the new rules—the most sweeping such mandate in the U.S.

title: The Legacy of GameStop Isn’t as Triumphant as Dumb Money Suggests
description: The movie "Dumb Money" depicts the GameStop stock craze as a David and Goliath story. The truth is a little more complicated.

title: To Zainab Salbi, Supporting Women Is the Key to Social Progress
description: Zainab Salbi tells TIME about the experiences that led her to found Women for Women International.

title: Elizabeth Wathuti Is Planting the Seeds of Climate Action
description: Since 2016, Elizabeth Wathuti’s organization has planted more than 30,000 trees in her home country of Kenya.

title: Eric Nam Wants to Remind Everyone That No One Has ‘Perfect’ Mental Health
description: Eric Nam shares his thoughts on his latest album, "House on a Hill," and his work on mental health.

title: Ke Huy Quan Wants You to Never Give Up on Your Dreams
description: When Ke Huy Quan won his historic Oscar for Best Supporting Actor this March, it was a testament to his perseverance.

title: Ayushmann Khurrana Is a Bollywood Star Like No Other
description: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana is not your average Bollywood A-lister.

title: TIME Debuts Ranking of the World’s Best Companies in Partnership with Statista
description: The new annual TIME World’s Best Companies list with Statista’s leading research ranks 750 of the world's top-performing companies

title: Google Faces Biggest Antitrust Trial in Decades
description: Federal regulators are attempting to dismantle Google's empire in the biggest U.S. antitrust trial in decades.

title: Israeli Supreme Court Hears First Challenge to Netanyahu’s Contentious Judicial Overhaul
description: Israel’s Supreme Court opened the first case to look at the legality of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s contentious judicial overhaul.

title: How TIME and Statista Determined the World’s Best Companies of 2023
description: This year, TIME launched its inaugural list of the World’s Best Companies, in partnership with Statista, a leading international provider of market and consumer data and rankings. The result of this quantitative study: 750 companies forging the path into the future. Here’s how the winners were selected. Methodology The research project “World’s Best Companies 2023”…

title: Finding Power in My Panic Attacks
description: "There was nothing specific that brought on this particular panic—and that’s what is often so terrorizing about them," writes Matt Gutman.

title: Ken Burns on How to Teach the Dark Parts of History
description: In a video provided exclusively to TIME, Ken Burns talks to a high school teacher about the culture wars and how to teach history.

title: Russia and North Korea’s Complicated Relationship: A Timeline
description: Despite their often aligning interests, relations between Russia and North Korea have experienced highs and lows.

title: 70 Crocodiles Are on the Loose, Officials Say, After Deadly Storms Hit Southern China
description: Rainstorms battering southern China have killed at least seven people and allowed dozens of crocodiles to escape from a farm.

title: Nobel Peace Prizewinning Philippine Journalist Maria Ressa Cleared of Tax Evasion Charges
description: A Philippine court acquitted Nobel laureate Maria Ressa and her media company Rappler—a move that may help but won’t entirely calm concerns over media freedom in one of Asia’s oldest democracies.

title: Thousands Feared Dead in Libya After Flooding
description: Mediterranean storm Daniel caused devastating floods in Libya that broke dams and swept away entire neighborhoods in multiple coastal towns in the east of the North African nation.
